Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Blocked due to non-porous nature of the framework

Blocked due to non-porous nature of the framework

Sieving Mechanism: Framework densification upon desolvation leading to a non-porous material, preventing molecular passage.

Experimental Validation.Method: Gas and vapor sorption studies (adsorption isotherms)
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Negligible uptake for all tested gases (N2: ~12 mL/g; CO2: 13 mL/g; H2: 18 mL/g) and vapors (H2O, EtOH).

Other Information.Additional Info: Flexible framework of compound 1 undergoing reversible single-crystal-to-single-crystal (SC-SC) structural transformation upon desolvation to form 1a, resulting in a higher dimensional polycatenated non-porous structure.

Pore/Structural Features.Structure Type: Doubly interpenetrated three-dimensional (3D) net with very narrow 1D channels, honeycomb-like structure

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size exclusion and steric hindrance due to bulky -NO2 group and interpenetrated network within narrow channels

Other Information.Additional Info: Low uptake (~96 mL/g) due to negligible void spaces and narrow channels.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size exclusion and steric hindrance due to bulky -NO2 group and interpenetrated network within narrow channels

Other Information.Additional Info: Low uptake (~27 mL/g) due to negligible void spaces and narrow channels.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size exclusion and steric hindrance due to bulky -NO2 group and interpenetrated network within narrow channels

Other Information.Additional Info: Low uptake (11 mL/g) due to negligible void spaces and narrow channels.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Polar adsorption, preferred orientation within channels enabled by polar -NO2 group, and suitable molecular size for passage

Other Information.Additional Info: High uptake (163 mL/g) with reversible desorption. Proposed as a drying agent.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size exclusion due to higher kinetic diameter and less polarity compared to water, leading to limited passage

Other Information.Additional Info: Low uptake (14 mL/g), significantly lower than water. Framework shows 'extensive affection' for water over EtOH.

Sieving Mechanism: Selective adsorption based on polarity and size exclusion, influenced by narrow channel dimensions and steric hindrance from internal functional groups.

Experimental Validation.Method: Gas and vapor sorption studies (adsorption isotherms)
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: H2O uptake: 163 mL/g at 298 K, P/P0 = 0.9; EtOH uptake: 14 mL/g at 298 K, P/P0 = 0.9. N2 uptake: ~96 mL/g, H2 uptake: ~27 mL/g, CO2 uptake: 11 mL/g.

Other Information.Additional Info: Robust framework of compound 2 that retains crystallinity upon de/rehydration to form 2a. Contains a polar -NO2 group within the pore channel influencing vapor sorption.
